data.raw: Dear all, We need five graduate student volunteers AND five undergraduate student volunteers to help with our annual ACM-ICPC programming REGIONAL contest. This year we have a total of 21 teams participating at our site from around the region. Perk Volunteers will get a T-shirt and food and a LOT of satisfaction. ðŸ˜‰ Date needed: Saturday November 3rd. Work Time Several hours between 8am and 5pm. If interested, just reply to this email (BY NEXT Tuesday Many Thanks, Simanta
data.subject: ACM ICPC Regional Volunteers needed (both Grads and Undergrads)

data.raw: In addition to very positive in-person comments there are been a number of emails like thi Begin forwarded message: From: "Warburton, Marilyn" < Subject: RE: R F Baker Annual Plant Breeding Field Day and Hatch Act Social BBQ Date: October 2, 2018 at 9:47:26 AM CDT To: "Singh, Asheesh K [AGRON]" < "Plant Breeding and Genetics Graduate Students [AGRON]" < Cc: "Plant Breeding and Genetics Faculty [AGRON]" < " < Resent-From: < Please excuse the late reply to this email. I also wanted to congratulate all responsible for the excellent field day. It was very professionally run, in addition to being informative and educational! I was so very honored to be a part of it, and the dinner (and sauces and salsas!) were deliciou Best regards, Marilyn Warburton From: Singh, Asheesh K [AGRON] [] Sent: Thursday, September 27, 2018 9:01 AM To: Plant Breeding and Genetics Graduate Students [AGRON] < Cc: Plant Breeding and Genetics Faculty [AGRON] < Warburton, Marilyn < Subject: R F Baker Annual Plant Breeding Field Day and Hatch Act Social BBQ Dear students, I congratulate you all for making yesterdayâ€™s event a huge succe It was wonderful to see a large turnout for both event We had several non-ISU visitors in attendance, and the feedback I received was very positive. Special thanks to Ben, Kevin and Vishnu for all their hard work in organizing this event. We are very appreciative of R F Baker Center for Plant Breeding to sponsor the two events, as well as support from numerous faculty and staff for their contributions in various aspects of these event We sincerely appreciate Dr. Bosland and Dr. Warburton for gracing the occasion. Thanks to Dr. Bosland and Dr. Beavis for bringing chili sample Thanks to Dr. Lamkey for spending the day with us, and all faculty members and their teams for presenting and/or for joining the event. If you have feedback for this yearâ€™s event and/or suggestions for next yearâ€™s event, please email me directly. Best regards, Asheesh K Singh (Danny) Associate Professor Monsanto Chair in Soybean Breeding 1501 Agronomy Hall, Iowa State University 515-294-3268 This electronic message contains information generated by the USDA solely for the intended recipient Any unauthorized interception of this message or the use or disclosure of the information it contains may violate the law and subject the violator to civil or criminal penaltie If you believe you have received this message in error, please notify the sender and delete the email immediately. Patrick S. Schnable C.F. Curti Distinguished Professor Iowa Corn Endowed Chair in Genetics Baker Scholar of Agricultural Entrepreneurship Director, Plant Sciences Institute 2035B Roy J Carver Co-Lab 1111 WOI Rd Iowa State University Ames, IA 50011-3650 USA 515-294-0975 (office) Twitter:
data.subject: Fwd: R F Baker Annual Plant Breeding Field Day and Hatch Act Social BBQ

data.raw: Welcome Engineering Students! Quick Guide to Engineering Information Technology Resources Computer Lab information Want to know where the Engineering labs are? Want to see if a lab has open seats before walking around campu Visit our site at Keep Your Computer Labs Clean! Take pride in your computer labs! Please pickup after yourself and keep the labs clean for you and everyone else. As always, there is NO FOOD OR DRINK allowed in computer lab Lost and Found If you lose an item in one of the computer labs or need to turn in a lost item, please visit one of our Lost and Found location 2071 Black Engineering, 2215 Coover Hall, 2240 Hoover Hall, and 1200 Howe Hall. Remember to write your name on calculators and other items of value so they can be easily identified if lost. We will require proof before returning lost item Printing As an Engineering student you receive 4,000 print units per semester. Black and white printing is 5 units per side and color is 15 units per side. Lab computers automatically have local printers added. You are also able to print from a personal computer using Papercut Web Print or Google Print. Please visit and for detail Remote Acce Many of the applications available in the computer labs are also available remotely using your own computer. Please visit for more details and instructions on how to connect. CyBox ISU offers all students unlimited storage through a partnership with called CyBox. Visit for detail Personal Drive Please note it is limited to 10 GB. Microsoft Office and Engineering applications for FREE! For a list of titles, visit our IT portal at Departmental Specific Resources Did you know each major has their own dedicated IT staff? Check with your departmental IT staff for information about unique resources available to your major. Other Question All this information and more can be found at . If you have any other questions, please fill out our contact form located at Please remember when contacting us that your ISU e-mail addre is the most important piece of information we need about you. Your University ID (9-digit number) is not needed. Distributed by Engineering Technology Support. Copyright Â© 2018, Iowa State University of Science and Technology. All rights reserved. You are receiving this message as a student at Iowa State University. Unsubscribe
data.subject: Welcome Engineering Students to your Engineering Information Technology resources!

data.raw: September Undergraduate Newsletter Curriculum Corner Welcome back from all of us in Student Services! We are trying to meet as many of you as possible in the first 10 days of classes to make sure everything is set for your semester! If it is like the summerâ€”it will whiz by! 1) Please note that we will be celebrating Scholarsâ€™ Fair on Tuesday, Sept. 11, from 5:30 p.m. â€“ 7 p.m. Please join us in the excitement of student organization membership, faculty and grad student research and lots of giveaway 2) Welcome Dr Mai Zheng and Mohamed Selim as new computer engineering faculty members! Youâ€™ll probably see them in the hallways of Coover. 3) Remember that appointments can be made on AccessPlus . 4) As you think of spring semester, we will be teaching EE 439, EE 425x and Cpr E/EE 503X (see the experimental course list 5) If you are still looking for a part-time job, Vicky is trying to find an undergrad TAs for Engr 160, Cpr E 381, EE/Cpr E 294 and 394 Undergraduate Circuit First FAN Club meeting of the year, 9/28 - FREE PIZZA!!! Want to be a part of something more Join one of our student orgs! From solar decatholons to engineering ambassadors, we have so much for you!! Click here to see all our student organization  Don't forget about all of our opportunities to better your chances of scoring a job at the career fair! Study Abroad Fair, Tuesday, Sept. 4 - Come and see ALL the places YOU can study in around the WORLD! Summer Sparks Check out some of the research and moments that happened over this summer!! McCune 1910 surveying notebook 1910 surveying notebook shows Iowa Stateâ€™s campus through the eyes â€” and feet â€” of ECpE alum A notebook from ECpE alum Charles E McCune was recently discovered in Ohio by a woman with no ties to Iowa State. After returning the book to ISU, ECpE dives into the tale of Charles E. McCune. The nine lives of Mani Mina Mani Mina, an associate professor in industrial design and electrical and computer engineering in ECpE is very popular amongst students, alumni and faculty. From theater to history of science, Mina has a broad range of studies that he was reeled into when he was in college. ECpE engineer published for Alzheimerâ€™s-testing device Present in the lives of millions, Alzheimer disease is a prominent concern throughout the world. Long Que , associate professor and researcher in the Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering at Iowa State University , has recently developed a device that can determine if a person potentially has Alzheimerâ€™s disease along with Dr. Pan Deng, a neurologist and Chao Song, a PhD student in electrical engineering. Students compete in PrISUm - following the Oregon Trail With a mission to change transportation, PrISUm was along for the ride with other students from around the nation this summer, following the Oregon Trail. Read about the student favorite part of PrISUm - and advice if you'd like to join. Tech Buzz Computer program looks 5 minutes into the future As humans, we are usually fairly accurate when predicting what another person will do next. Bur for computers, predicting a human actions has been a challenge - until now. This computer is a chef perfect partner, foreshadowing when to grab some ingredients and what ingredients to grab - without a single command! Seminars and Events Sept. 6, 10 a.m. - John Deere Day at Iowa State University Sept. 11, 5:30 p.m. - ECpE Scholar Fair Sept. 18, 12 p.m. - Iowa State University Engineering Career Fair Sept. 25, 12 p.m. - Iowa State University Engineering Career Fair Sept. 28, 11 a.m. - FAN Club John Deere Day Happy September! Check out our socials!     This email was sent to why did I get thi unsubscribe from this list update subscription preferences Iowa State University Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering . 2520 Osborn Drive . 2215 Coover Hall . Ames, IA 50011 . USA
data.subject: ISU ECpE September Undergraduate Newsletter

data.raw: Hi Jack, Have you ever thought about study or work abroad? Make sure you check out this wonderful event to learn more about how you can have an engineering-related international experience! TOUR THE WORLD Engineering Work & Study Abroad Fair! In the Howe Hall Atrium we bring the world of International Opportunities for Engineering Students to you! If you know you want to go abroad, or are even just wondering about the possibility, come visit Tour The World to learn about over 30 different international experiences tailored to Engineering student Tuesday, September 4th 4:30 pm - 6:30 pm Howe Hall Atrium We have engineering programs that are affordable, apply toward graduation, and are English speaking. Attend and find the international experience that is perfect for you! INTERNATIONAL: SNACKS, INFORMATION, PRIZES, & FUN!! For questions, or to learn more, please contact Engineering International Programs at Hope to see you there! Shannon Miner Come to Tour the World Engineering Work & Study Abroad Fair September 4, 4:30 pm - 6:30 pm Howe Hall Atrium Like us on Facebook at Iowa State University Engineering International<
data.subject: 9/4 TOUR THE WORLD Engineering Work & Study Abroad Fair!

data.raw: Jack, Hi! What: this semesterâ€™s first meeting of the Alliance for Disability Awarene (ADA) When: Wednesday August 29, 2018 at 5:00 PM (feel free to come late!) Where: the lobby of the Student Services Building More info: You are invited to this semesterâ€™s first meeting of the Alliance for Disability Awarene (ADA) a student organization on campus dedicated to supporting students with disabilities, as well as raising awarene for the wide variety of disabilities on campus and pushing for a more accessible ISU. This year the club has new presidential leadership of myself, Lauren Berglund and Brittni Wendling and we hope to increase student involvement through fun gatherings and activitie Please join us for pizza, conversation, and more! If you have any questions or need for accommodations, please feel free to email either myself at and/or Brittni at We hope to see you there! The ADA leadership team, Brittni Wendling (co-president) Lauren Berglund (co-president) + Sheba Leland Smith (vice-president) Amber Markley (social chair) Lauren Berglund Child, Adult, and Family Services | Iowa State University Student Assistant | Student Accessibility Services President | Alliance for Disability Awareness
data.subject: ADA Meeting

data.raw: Jack, Upcoming event Live Your Truth: A Queer and Trans People of Color Party? This event is a collaboration between The Center for LGBTQIA+ Student Succe and Multicultural Student Affair Live Your Truth is on Wednesday, August 29th from 5-7pm in the Cardinal Room, Memorial Union. There will be food, karaoke, games, and lots of ways to meet people! Students, faculty, and staff who identify as queer and/or trans people of color are welcome. Questions about this event can be sent to Student Accessibility Services 1076 Student Services Building 2505 Union Drive 515-294-7220 NOTICE: This e-mail message may contain private or confidential information, including educational, health,personnel, or other information, that is protected by federal and/or state privacy law If you are not the intended recipient of this message or if this message has been addressed to you in error, please immediately alert the sender by reply e-mail and then delete this message. Improper review, dissemination, distribution, or duplication of this message is strictly
data.subject: Food, fun, and karaoke at the QTPOC Party!

data.raw: Welcome to the Daily Dose! Read about the SUB Spring Concert announcement, see snowy pictures from Monday and more. Share Tweet Forward Fetty Wap, Cheat Codes, Kyle and Andreas Mo will be performing at the Spring Concert on April 22. 'iSpy' Fetty Wap coming 'my way' I got something I want to say, Fetty Wap is coming our way! The Student Union Board released the lineup of artists that will be performing at the Outdoor Concert on April 22. Fetty Wap will be joined by Cheat Codes, Kyle and Andreas Mo Tickets are available right now for $25 with a student ID. SUB previously announced that the concert will be in the parking lot of the Molecular Biology building on Iowa State campu Read More! Iowa State juniors Bryant Jasper (front) and Lauren Gifford cro country ski on campus Feb. 5. Despite heavy snow and poor road conditions, classes were not officially cancelled by the university. Snow daze The snow was coming down in sheets on Monday, but that didn't stop students from making the slippery trek to cla Some students made the best of the weather and took up on the opportunity to break out cro country ski Check out our photos of students braving the weather! Read More! Tyrrell: Another humanitarian crisis no one cares about Cape Town, South Africa is close to facing a major crisis that exceeds anything any other city has faced since 9/11 and World War II, but have you even heard about it? The answer is probably no because no one is even talking about it. Cape Town is experiencing one of the worst droughts in history due to climate change and the low amount of precipitation. This means that the city is extremely low on water, resulting in most public taps being shut off on April 12. Read More! Students explore the different booths on the floor of Hilton Coliseum for the Busine career fair. Prepare for the fair The career fairs are upon us! Are you prepared? We have tips for networking, interviewing, cover letters and resume Read up on them here . Open Bible at the front of a church Biblical bill "Biblical literacy" classes may be coming to Iowa high school Professors of religion and history from Iowa major universities are condemning the bill. Read more about it here . Daily Dates Are you single and ready to mingle? Are you interested in getting set up on a free date? Apply here and we might choose you to be a part of our social dating experiment! Are you in a committed relationship and interested in the opportunity to go on a free date? Apply here and we might choose you to be a part of our social dating experiment! Pro tip of the day Networking is really just making friends and maintaining a positive reputation. If you think of it that way, it not so bad! Networking can happen anywhere, it doesn't have to be a formal event. -Taren Crow, Director of LAS Career Services Today Events Research Workshop: Sponsored Funding Budgets 8:30 a.m. to 10 a.m. 3512 MU Performance: Charlotte Web 10 a.m. to 11 a.m. Stephens Auditorium Workshop: Assignments and Gradebook in Canvas 10 a.m. to 11:30 a.m. 116 Durham Career Fair: College on Engineering Noon to 6 p.m. Hilton Coliseum and Scheman Building Performance: Charlotte Web 12:30 p.m. to 1 :30 p.m. Stephens Auditorium Faculty Development Worksop: Preparing for the Next Step 1 p.m. to 12:30 p.m. Campanile Room, MU Gold Star Training for Faculty and Staff 1 p.m. to 2 p.m. Cardinal Room, MU #SquadCare POP UP SHOP 5 p.m. to 7:30 p.m. 3rd floor of Catt Hall Food Photography 6 p.m. to 8:30 p.m. Reiman Gardens Have your own event you want to add to the events box?
